name: Twin Harbors
economy_niches: Transshipment hub for ritual reagents and imported supplies
Shipbuilding, repair yards and fittings workshops
Salted and preserved seafood processing and export
Maritime brokerage, insurance and freight contracting
Repair-labor pools specializing in ritual-compatible vessels
culture_adjustments: Guild courts hold stronger civic authority than in hinterland towns
Tide-calendar tightly integrated with work schedules and public rites
Navigation auguries are commercialized and routinized
Practical, contract-focused mercantile morality outweighs heraldic status
constraints: Ritual auguries consume scarce imported reagents; storage and supply are chokepoints
Limited adoption of high-pressure combustion industry
Long-range mind-influence practices prohibited in commercial law
notes: Key transit node for reagent imports serving coastal ritual networks
Guild-controlled docks settle most maritime disputes and contracts
